TITLE: 2001 vw passat wagon only 50000 miles on replaced engine
ATTR: fuel: gas#title status: clean#transmission: other
MESSAGE: hello;#i am selling my 2001 vw passat wagon.   it is an older car; but the engine was replaced at around 75;000 miles; and it currently has around 128;000 as i am currently driving it.   vw  authorized a complete and professional overhaul of the engine due to some issues around their engines in these models.  i have extensive documentation of all work done.  the upside of the car is the great engine.  the downside is that the body is in need of a major repair;   it currently needs the front upper control arms replaced which can be around a thousand dollars.  however; the majority of that cost is in labor so this could be a good deal if you can work on it yourself (there are numerous youtube videos) or have a friendly mechanic friend.    it does run well though; and i have recently put in several hundred to have the battery replaced; oil changed; and some headlights replaced.  i would keep the car and invest in the major repair but have already decided to move on to a different type of car.  this would not be for someone just looking to flip a car and make a profit as i wont sell it low enough ; but could be great for someone looking to invest for the long term as i think the engine will last.  most cars on cl will need some kind of repair;  at least this one is known  thanks for looking.  feel free to email with questions; and i am definitely open to arranging an inspection and would encourage it.  have a great day.#david

TITLE: 1999 volkswagen passat 1.8t
ATTR: condition: good#cylinders: 4 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 161700#paint color: black#size: mid-size#title status: clean#transmission: manual#type: sedan
MESSAGE: i am selling my passat after almost 7 years of ownership; as i am moving across the country soon.#this vehicle gets great gas mileage; especially for its age. the four cylinder; 1.8 l; engine runs well and is equipped with a turbocharger. on a recent trip to portland; i averaged over 35 mpg. with a 16.4 gallon gas tank; you can go quite a ways before having to fill up! the front two tires are in good condition. the back two have greater wear on the outside edge of the tire; but have another few thousand miles left on them. i have two additional used tires from a neighbor that have a decent amount of tread left and will include those also.#the trunk is quite spacious; and the rear seats fold down (7:3 split) to accommodate larger items. with the front wheels off; i have even transported two adult bikes. the original 6-disc cd player is accessed in the trunk and is a nice; quirky feature! as you can see; the interior is in great condition.#last summer i replaced the oil pan (i overtightened the drain plug while changing the oil and opened a crack) and tie rods. i had new brake rotors and calipers put on in june 2014. the battery was replaced in the summer of 2015. there are minor oil and coolant leaks; but as long as you are checking fluids every couple weeks to be safe; it shouldnt be an issue. two years ago; i polished the headlights to remove the haziness. the airbag light is on and the mechanic told me it was likely a faulty sensor that needed to be replaced.#the body is in pretty good shape. there are a few superficial scratches from over the years; but i have been diligent in touching up any rock chips in the paint with autobody primer and paint. the front; right bumper shroud is a little loose and hangs a bit lower than the left side. the window regulator for the passenger side rear window is broken; so the window doesnt raise and lower well. this is a pretty easy fix if youre willing to take the door panel off; but i havent gotten around the ordering the parts. the motor still works; so parts should only be $40. the hose from the compressor to the condenser of the ac unit is leaking so the ac doesnt work; but as mild as seattle summers are; ive never really missed it.#contact me if youd like to swing by to take a look at it or take it for a test drive. ill try to get back to you asap with answers to any of your questions.

TITLE: 2003 volkswagen passat 1.8 l turbo
ATTR: condition: fair#cylinders: 4 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#paint color: silver#size: compact#title status: clean#transmission: manual#type: wagon
MESSAGE: i am selling my 2003 volkswagen passat 1.8 l turbo awm b5 model manual 5-speed station wagon.#it has 235;000 miles.#it has a blown head gasket; its pretty bad. uses coolant; big vapors on startup; but no temperature issues. still runs and drives strong; but misfires badly at start and is throwing codes for cylinder 2 and 4.#the ecu on this car has been upgraded with an apr ecu. this is plug and play on any awm 1.8l t fwd stick; whether audi or vw. when new; this ecu was a little under $2k. it has 4 modes:#1.) stock vw mapping 91/92 octane#2.) sport mapped 91/92 octane#3.) race mapped 94 octane#4.) race mapped 100 octane (247hp)#it is also capable of clearing fault codes and resetting the throttle body. the manual is in the car and complete.#car has black leather interior; a pyle all-digital (no discs) touch screen. plays all music files and videos put onto a usb/microsd. has bluetooth/aux; remote control; speakerphone feature and can be wired to the steering wheel control. the car has wireless transmitters for a back up camera installed on the head unit; but not wired to the reverse light; nor is the camera installed. i will include these parts.#the body is pretty straight; all windows; sunroof work. trunk hatch must be opened with the key. fuel door switch has failed; so it must be opened manually through the side panel or left open a crack.#has 15 aftermarket wheels with de studded snow tires at about 85%. 195/60r15 with a variable bolt pattern. i forget the measurements; but most japanese/german 4 and 5 post lugs.#bentley manual included#thats the best full disclosure i can think of... it is reparable if doing head gaskets is your thing. definitely not mine. it really is in pretty good shape for its mileage; and still runs fast and strong with great boost once the cylinders are purged. it also has lots and lots of good parts if you already have one and need a complete parts car and want an ecu that will make your awm motor instantly fast. i am only selling the complete car. please do not write inquiring about parts. i am not selling any. all for $1250. obo

TITLE: 2003 vw passat wagon glx v6
ATTR: fuel: gas#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: selling my beloved wagon. runs great. just had timing belt and water pump done in february at the vw dealership (good for another 80;000 miles); all new brake pads and rotors; new tires last year; sunroof; heated seats; great sounding monsoon system. great looking and riding car. the v6 gives you some power and you can also manually shift using tiptronic mode; which is awesome for kicking it into gear to pass people. oil always changed on time. has about 178;000 miles on original engine.#important details:#i drive this car daily and have driven it all over the pnw this year. never let me down!#things to know:#the check engine light has intermittently come on. i enjoy working on cars; so researched the fault code (p0441). this has to do with excess fuel vapor being absorbed into a charcoal canister. i have never experienced an impact on the performance of the vehicle; but its annoying to see the light. after researching in the forums; i replaced two parts (gas cap and evap purge valve) which both have caused this fault for some people; but the code is still there. the last thing to change is the charcoal canister; which is around $100 on ebay and not a tough job if you are handy. im guessing that will fix fault code and the light will go away. never had any other fault codes.#second; recenly two lights came on the have to do with the abs system. the brakes are new and work great; but the lights are on most of the time. fat city (german car specialist in downtown) said it is probably the abs module. they can be replaced easily and a remanufactured abs module can be had for around $250 on ebay; i just dont have the time to do it.#third; my co-worker put a very light scratch in the door while backing out of a parking spot. it is not very noticeable; but otherwise body is great. drivers seat leather is worn in one area and has a rip.#otherwise; it has been a great ride. these are some of the best vehicles ever designed. thankfully; the issues dont impact my driving at all.#please shoot me an email with your name and number if you are interested or have questions and i will give you a call.

ATTR: VIN: WVWLK63B03E407802#condition: excellent#cylinders: 8 cylinders#drive: 4wd#fuel: gas#odometer: 126500#paint color: silver#title status: clean#transmission: manual#type: wagon
MESSAGE: rare opportunity to own a super cool; well maintained; fully loaded; awd w8 6-speed manual man-wagon. this is a true unicorn with fewer than 100 of these 4.0l w8 wagons imported from europe with the manual gearbox and sport package. having 126k mostly highway miles; this wagon has safely taken our family to obx and back for nearly a decade.  the interior is clean (non smoker); however; the leather is showing its age (especially on the drivers seat).  the exterior is not perfect with minor imperfections.  the original w8 madras bbs-style rims will convey; however; due to a design flaw in the rim construction; they will need to be refurbished to be usable (they have a slow air leak). the sound system works (even has a remote); however; the sound quality is intermittent (you can sometimes hear the rpm in the sound). serviced almost exclusively by eurowerks since my ownership; see a non-exhaustive list of service/parts replaced below. candidly; this w8 wagon is a true performance car and is not for everyone. ideal fit is a true enthusiast who understands the versatility and fun that these sport wagons represent.  if you are into audi or bmw sport wagons; you will want to consider this one.  i hope that her next owner will maintain and enjoy her as much as i have. carfax report available. $7;800.#new clutch; slave cylinder and reservoir (less than 300 miles ago)#new radiator and reservoir#new spark plugs#new tires and wheels (less than 200 miles)#new control arms and front suspension parts#new motor mounts#new complete front axles (cv joints)#new o2 sensors#new complete prop shaft#new ac unit and condenser

TITLE: 2006 vw passat bodyshop special
ATTR: cylinders: 4 cylinders#fuel: gas#odometer: 135000#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: english version below#mi mama compro este carro nuevo y me lo regalo hace unos aos. alguien me choco la puerta del pasajero trasero hace unas semanas y dejo el carro en perdida total. sin embargo; el carro anda perfecto y esta en buen orden mecanicamente hablando. lo uso a diario y me no he tenido probelma mecanico desde que lo tengo en el 2012.#lo que si tiene el carro: (1) como puede ver en las fotos; un choque - pero la puerta actual abre y cierra asi que una puerta nueva deberia de servirle sin ajuste; (2) la bomba del liquido de parabrisas no funciona; (3) la palanca hidraluica que levanta el capot no funciona; (4) algunos asuntos electricos; las luces de cabina no funcionan y la puerta trasera del lado del conductor solo abre desde adentro; (5) como cualquier motor viejo; requiere estar echandole aciete de mes en cuando; o sea cada miles de millas (depende de que tan duro maneje usted).#de nuevo; el carro corre perfectamente; el ultimo tema es que despues del accidente; si el carro va cargado de peso o a velocidad; la llanta trasera del pasajero puede rozar contra el guarda barros. tiene arreglo; no ha causado ningun problema y no pasa mucho a menos de que este manejando como un animal.#uso el carrio a diario para conducir 16 millas en mopac y no he tenido ni un problema desde el accidente.#gracias;#english version:#my mother purchased this car new and gifted it to me a few years ago. someone crashed into the rear passenger side recently and totaled the car; though the car runs perfectly and is currently still my daily driver; with the engine is running perfectly with no apparent issues.#the issues the car does have: (1) as you can see from the pictures; wrecked door and panels - however the door still opens and closes; so a new door should just slide on; (2) the windshield wiper fluid pump is out; (3) the front hood lift (that hydraulic lever that holds the hood open) is out; (4) the electrics are funky; the cabin lights are out; and the rear doors only open from the inside; and finally; (5) like any older engine; some oil is consumed and requires topping off every few weeks or about a few thousand miles (depends on how you drive).#again; the car works perfectly; the last issue; caused by the recent accident is that at speed or if the car is loaded; there is very occasional rubbing of the rear passenger tire against the wheel well. this can be addressed without fixing the body work by pushing out the dent from the wheel well.#i drive to work 8 miles on mopac no problem; and have not had any issues since the accident.#thanks;

TITLE: 2015 volkswagen passat tdi sel premium
ATTR: fuel: diesel#title status: clean#transmission: automatic
MESSAGE: 2015 passat tdi sel premium. this car was bought new on may 20th; 2017. it was purchased with 1;053 miles and currently has 1450. after the vw diesel emissions was discovered in september of 2015 all 2015 tdi models currently in inventory were not permitted to be sold. this car was in storage at a vw dealership until purchase. the 2015 models became available for purchase about a month ago. this one has been updated by vw to meet epa/carb emissions requirements. if interested; the updated and all information regarding the emissions can be found on volkswagens website.#the passat is volkswagens mid-large size sedan. the rear seat and leg room are first in its class in my opinion. i currently have a vw jetta; and while it has sufficient leg room as well for an adult; it is no comparison to the passat. the same can be said for ride quality. it is very smooth and drives very well in town as it does on cruise control on the interstate. the navigation is displayed on the media screen if desired and also in the dash cluster; independent of the media screen. for comfort and drive-ability it is a very well-engineered sedan.#the sel premium is the top of the line for vw. it is the only option that offered true leather seats instead of the leatherette. this passat has every factory option available including but not limited to power heated leather seats; fender audio with navigation and dvd; remote start; keyless start; infotainment; and cornering lights. it is platinum grey with titan black leather interior. it has the 2.0 turbo diesel engine with the dsg six speed automatic transmission with auto/manual option.#the volkswagen warranty of 36;000 mile/3 year started on may 20th; 2017. also included with this passat is an extended transferrable at no cost 100;000 mile/6 year warranty that covers nearly everything besides your wear and tear items such as brakes; tires; fluids etc. the extended warranty also started may 20th; 2017.#for those interested; this is most likely your last chance to own a new vw tdi. unfortunately; the diesels are not expected to make a return to the us after the emissions issue. for those wondering why it is for sale - i bought this car as soon as vw released them for sale. i picked it up on may 20th due to the fact that i knew it would be the last one i could buy. i am currently a 2012 tdi jetta owner; and i prefer the manual transmission that it has. i decided to buy the passat regardless. with that being said - i do not need to sell the passat. offers are not entertained. you are getting a like-new car with a 6 year 100;000 mile warranty. if travelling is part of your life; this car would be a great investment

TITLE: 2000 volkswagen passat gls v6 2.8l 5spd manual b5
ATTR: condition: excellent#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 133352#paint color: silver#size: full-size#title status: clean#transmission: manual#type: sedan
MESSAGE: i am selling my 2000 passat that is quite possibly the best condition b5 you will find around here. this vw passat has been my daily driver for over a year now. i bought it from a dealer that received it via trade in and i have had extensive preventative maintenance done since i bought the car. i was expecting this to be a long term car for the family; plans changed because we need an suv. as seen in the pictures; this car is in excellent shape; with a few minor scrapes on the bumpers and paint in almost perfect condition. the interior is still very high quality after 17 years with almost no imperfections. non-smoker vehicle that was maintained carefully.#since owning i have had the following replaced:#- timing belt; serpentine belt; temperature sensor gauge; timing belt tensioner; and water pump.#- pcv system#- valve cover gaskets#- flex pipes#- new front and like new rear tires with well over 70% tread.#- brand new front brakes (500 miles) and rear brakes still in great shape.#- oil changed with full synthetic every 4500 miles#- all new premium speakers and aftermarket head unit (i still have the original w/ 6 cd changer that i would be happy to include.)#- new signal lights#- all new spark plugs (200 miles)#this car has been extremely reliable for me and i am sad to have to get rid of such a great car; but we dont have the room and we would like to use the money towards a down payment on a newer suv. this is an excellent car for someone wanting to learn stick; or someone who likes to commute to work in a car thats fun to drive and economical. i work 25 miles each way to work and would use less than a tank per full weeks commute.#the pictures speak for themselves; i have a picture showing the valve cover off when i had the gasket changed to show the excellent condition of the engine.#i am pricing this car to sell; you would be hard pressed to find a b5 in condition anywhere close to this.

TITLE: 2005 volkswagen passat wagon
ATTR: condition: good#cylinders: 4 cylinders#drive: 4wd#fuel: gas#odometer: 167000#paint color: grey#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: wagon
MESSAGE: im selling my beloved wagon. it fits a lot of things and its great for winter driving.#engine: 4 cylinder 1.8l turbo; all-wheel drive#mileage: about 167;000#color: gray#other: the timing belt was replaced maybe 10-20 thousand miles ago (they last i think 100;000 miles or more). tires probably have about half of their life left. bosch brake pads and rotors are maybe 200 miles old. the cars interior is in very good condition. keyless entry remote. hitch installed. automatic. drives great. i have driven to the the east coast with it so many times. it has never been in any accident as far as i know.#the bad stuff: engine light is on; but since the car drives fine i havent checked it out. i got a new car so i dont need this one anymore. theres rust above the drivers side front tire and a tiny bit above the drivers side rear tire. also; i was told by the vw dealer that a plastic body undercover is missing (i never noticed) and that a metal hook that holds part of the exhaust should be replaced because the old one seems a little loose. they quoted me a price of like $2 for the part but maybe a half an hour of work to lift the car and install it; so i didnt go for it. another thing... i hit a pothole and got a small dent on one of the wheels; so im using the full-size spare. you can buy a wheel to match the 3 originals at discount tire for $180 (i just checked last week); or a junkyard could have it for a lot less. im including the dented wheel... the dent is barely visible; but it made the tire leak slowly. the original spare was older than 10 years; so discount tire wouldnt remount it. i had one of the four newer tires mounted on the full-size spare wheel. so if you want to have a spare youd also have to get a tire to fit the spare wheel. finally; the cd player doesnt work; but the radio does. im pricing the car low for these issues and because i have no interest in the car sitting in my driveway for too long. i have a folder full of records for it.#let me know if you want to check it out. youre free to have your mechanic examine it. im planning on selling my old made-in-the-usa hollywood hitch-mounted bike rack for $50 (it wont fit in my new car); but if you need it i can include it for just $20. many years ago i bought two used roof racks specific to a 2005 passat; but when i tried to install them; they didnt seem to fit. i didnt spend much time trying; so they may fit just fine. ill include them for free if you want to try to fit them to the roof (keys included). oh; i bought the tools necessary to patch up the two places where theres rust; and i had a paint can made to match my paint. but i never had the time to actually do it. so if you want them; i can include the can of bondo; custom paint; etc. cash only please.
